metadata.dc:author: Cabrera Iboleón, Justo
Gil Ortega, Milagros
Martín Castro, Carmen
Gómez Jiménez, Francisco Javier
Macías Rodríguez, Fermina
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To determine the occult mortality in the extra-hospital setting. PATIENTS AND METHOD Retrospective study included patients who required health care using the Andalusian Emergency Services from January 2002 to June 2002 and who remained at home or were transferred to an Emergency department of a hospital in a normal ambulance as they were not considered to be in need of emergency assistance. RESULTS Of the 562 patients who met the inclusion criteria of this study, 17 patients died after this care, which was an occult mortality of 3%, 8 of whom had remained at home. CONCLUSIONS The occult mortality in this study is not insignificant; it affects all ages and is mainly due to respiratory disorders.
metadata.dc:title: Mortalidad oculta en el ámbito extrahospitalario.
[Not Available].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista de calidad asistencial : organo de la Sociedad Espanola de Calidad Asistencial
